com.topcoder.util.format
Class FormatMethodFactory

java.lang.Object
  com.topcoder.util.format.FormatMethodFactory
public class FormatMethodFactory
extends java.lang.Object

A factory class for creating standard format methods. Most of these factory methods take parameters that indicate how formatting should occur.

Formatting dates:

The format strings for Dates have a syntax that follows the date and time pattern strings for java.text.SimpleDateFormat. A SimpleDateFormat can be supplied in addition to a format string, in which case that SimpleDateFormat's date-formatting information will be used. If none is supplied, then the default SimpleDateFormat for the current locale will be used for date-formatting information. If no format string is supplied, then the format string used is the current pattern string for the supplied SimpleDateFormat (or the default pattern string for SimpleDateFormat if no SimpleDateFormat is supplied).

Version:
1.0
Author:
KurtSteinkraus, garyk
See Also:
SimpleDateFormat

Method Detail

getDefaultDateFormatMethod

public static DateFormatMethod getDefaultDateFormatMethod(java.lang.String format)
                                                   throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Gets a Date format method that will format dates according to the supplied format string. The syntax of the format string is given above, in the class javadoc. The current default locale is assumed. If format == null, then the default formatting string "MM/dd/yyyy" is used.

Parameters:
format - the formatting string
Returns:
a class to format Dates
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if format is an invalid format string

getDefaultDateFormatMethod

public static DateFormatMethod getDefaultDateFormatMethod(java.lang.String format,
                                                          java.text.SimpleDateFormat sdf)
                                                   throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Gets a Date format method that will format dates according to the supplied format string and the supplied SimpleDateFormat. The syntax of the format string is given above, in the class javadoc. If format == null, then sdf's current formatting string is used.

Parameters:
format - the formatting string
Returns:
a class to format Dates
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if format is an invalid format string

getDefaultObjectFormatMethod

public static ObjectFormatMethod getDefaultObjectFormatMethod()
Gets a default method for formatting Objects. The formatter simply returns the value of the toString method for any Object it formats.

Returns:
a class that trivially formats Objects
